description: The Microsoft cloud security benchmark initiative represents the policies and controls implementing security recommendations defined in Microsoft cloud security benchmark, see https://aka.ms/azsecbm. This also serves as the Microsoft Defender for Cloud default policy initiative. You can directly assign this initiative, or manage its policies and compliance results within Microsoft Defender for Cloud.

metadata.description: Enable or disable manage certificate validity period.

metadata.displayName: The maximum validity period in months of managed certificate
metadata.description: The limit to how long a certificate may be valid for. Certificates with lengthy validity periods aren't best practice.

metadata.displayName: Key Vault secrets should have expiration dates set
metadata.description: Enable or disable key vault secrets should have expiration dates set.

metadata.displayName: Key Vault keys should have expiration dates set
metadata.description: Enable or disable key vault keys should have expiration dates set.

metadata.displayName: Audit unrestricted network access to storage accounts
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of network access to storage account

metadata.displayName: Network Security Groups on the subnet level should be enabled
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of NSGs on subnets

metadata.displayName: SQL Managed Instance TDE protector should be encrypted with your own key
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) with your own key support. TDE with your own key support provides increased transparency and control over the TDE Protector, increased security with an HSM-backed external service, and promotion of separation of duties.
Enable or disable monitoring of Arc connected Windows machines

metadata.displayName: Cognitive Services accounts should enable data encryption with a customer-managed key
metadata.description: Customer-managed keys are commonly required to meet regulatory compliance standards. Customer-managed keys enable the data stored in Cognitive Services to be encrypted with an Azure Key Vault key created and owned by you. You have full control and responsibility for the key lifecycle, including rotation and management. Learn more about customer-managed key encryption at https://aka.ms/cosmosdb-cmk.

metadata.displayName: Azure Cosmos DB accounts should use customer-managed keys to encrypt data at rest
metadata.description: Use customer-managed keys to manage the encryption at rest of your Azure Cosmos DB. By default, the data is encrypted at rest with service-managed keys, but customer-managed keys are commonly required to meet regulatory compliance standards. Customer-managed keys enable the data to be encrypted with an Azure Key Vault key created and owned by you. You have full control and responsibility for the key lifecycle, including rotation and management. Learn more about customer-managed key encryption at https://aka.ms/cosmosdb-cmk.

metadata.displayName: Storage accounts should use customer-managed key for encryption
metadata.description: Secure your storage account with greater flexibility using customer-managed keys. When you specify a customer-managed key, that key is used to protect and control access to the key that encrypts your data. Using customer-managed keys provides additional capabilities to control rotation of the key encryption key or cryptographically erase data.

metadata.displayName: Container registries should be encrypted with a customer-managed key
metadata.description: Use customer-managed keys to manage the encryption at rest of the contents of your registries. By default, the data is encrypted at rest with service-managed keys, but customer-managed keys are commonly required to meet regulatory compliance standards. Customer-managed keys enable the data to be encrypted with an Azure Key Vault key created and owned by you. You have full control and responsibility for the key lifecycle, including rotation and management. Learn more about customer-managed key encryption at https://aka.ms/acr/CMK.

metadata.displayName: Azure Machine Learning workspaces should be encrypted with a customer-managed key
metadata.description: Manage encryption at rest of your Azure Machine Learning workspace data with customer-managed keys. By default, customer data is encrypted with service-managed keys, but customer-managed keys are commonly required to meet regulatory compliance standards. Customer-managed keys enable the data to be encrypted with an Azure Key Vault key created and owned by you. You have full control and responsibility for the key lifecycle, including rotation and management. Learn more about customer-managed key encryption at https://aka.ms/azureml-workspaces-cmk.

metadata.displayName: SQL server TDE protector should be encrypted with your own key
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) with your own key support. TDE with your own key support provides increased transparency and control over the TDE Protector, increased security with an HSM-backed external service, and promotion of separation of duties.

metadata.displayName: Data Protection (BYOK) should be enabled for MySQL servers
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of Data Protection with Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) support

metadata.displayName: Data Protection (BYOK) should be enabled for PostgreSQL servers
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of Data Protection with Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) support

metadata.displayName: Private endpoint should be configured for Key Vault
metadata.description: Private endpoints connect your virtual network to Azure services without a public IP address at the source or destination. By mapping private endpoints to key vault, you can reduce data leakage risks.
